intro: Corethrogyne cana, commonly known as the California corethrogyne, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Corethrogyne cana is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
